title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-3.5 - Failure to give 30 days advance notice for foreseeable leave
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-3.5 - Failure to give 30 days advance notice for foreseeable leave

State Regulations

When the need for family leave is foreseeable and an
employee fails to give 30 days advance notice, the self-insured employer or the
carrier may file a partial denial of the family leave claim for a period of up
to 30 days from the date notice is provided. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
380-3.5

Adopted

New

York State Register July 19, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 29, eff. 7/19/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
